did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.unittitle: Utica, NY, Building Trades Council Minute Books on Microfilm, 1933-1934
did.repository: Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Meeting minutes of the Building Trades Council of Utica, New York, from May 5, 1933 to July 26, 1934.

bioghist.head: ORGANIZATIONAL HISTORY
bioghist.p: The Building Trades Council is a constituionally mandated department of the AFL-CIO. It was started on February 10, 1908 to overcome the jurisdictional conflicts in the building and construction trade unions. It helps coordinate local unions in the building trades, with contract negotiations and apprenticeship and training programs.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: This consists of meeting minutes of the Building Trades Council of Utica, New York, from May 5, 1933 to July 26, 1934.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions:
accessrestrict.p: Access to the collections in the Kheel Center is restricted. Please contact a reference archivist for access to these materials.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use:
userestrict.p: This collection must be used in keeping with the Kheel Center Information Sheet and Procedures for Document Use.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: Utica, NY, Building Trades Council Minute Books on Microfilm #5829 mf. Kheel Center for Labor-Management Documentation and Archives, Cornell University Library.
